msbt.message: The horned dynastid looks rather valiant, I think. Like a knight with his sword drawn, ready for battle!
I confess, the giant stag's giant pincers scare me silly. I would NOT want it to pinch me, !
Saw stags look so fearsome, and yet I'm told they can be quite docile. I'm not sure which to believe!
The horned hercules's horns are more like giant pincers. It uses them to grab opponents and throw them!
Many people think mantises are scary, but I think it's darling the way they always seem to be waving hello.
The Madagascan sunset moth is like brocade fabricâ€”its colors change as you look at it from different angles.
It's a wonder that scarab beetles are so good at hiding from enemies. Just look at those eye-catching colors!
The great purple emperor is simply magnificent! It makes being gorgeous look easy, .
That line of red on the jewel beetle's wings is so lovely.What I wouldn't give to have a dress in that color, !
Striking colors, bold patternsit's as if the agrias butterfly is modeling haute couture on the catwalk!
The emperor butterfly's wings are so blue! It's as if they were made from a piece of the sky itself.
When I see a firefly's gentle light blinking on, off, on, offI find it so soothing I nearly drift off to sleep!
I've heard the Atlas moth's wingtips look like snake heads, and THAT'S how it scares away its enemies. Such a clever moth. Frighteningly clever, .
The Queen Alexandra's birdwing butterfly is so large, it looks like a bird when it takes flight!
My pearls, but scorpions are VERY heavily armed insects, don't you think? They have pincers AND a tail with a stinger! That seems like overkill to me, .
Oh dear! Th-this waspisn't going to sting me, is it?
I wonder if fireflies ever sleep during the day? After all, that bright light of theirs must keep them up at night.
The man-faced stink bugwhat a silly name! The patterns on its back DO look like a face, though!
My fins and feathers! There it is! If that walking leaf hadn't moved just now, I'd have missed it entirely.
It's truly a shame we can't hear this bell cricket's song. They are not much to look at, .
When cicadas grow, they leave their old shell behind and never look back. One must know when to move on!
This rosalia batesi beetle is a gorgeous color. It would make a lovely shade for an eyeshadow.
Damselflies are lovely. When males and females meet, they make the shape of a heart! It's very romantic.
Whenever I see a mosquito, I start feeling itchy all over. What terrible little pests they are! You know, if it weren't for all the blood sucking, they might not be so bad, .
Oh, ! This bug was one of your donations, wasn't it? Well, it's fabulous, !
Oh dear! The world of bugs is not always a peaceful one, it seems. Nature can be cruel, .
